episode_body:
Case: Elizabeth-Lindsey-MVA-12-01-2024
Client: Elizabeth Lindsey

This case involves Elizabeth Lindsey and her family members who were involved in a motor vehicle accident. The case is in the early stages of gathering medical records and bills, and dealing with insurance claims.
The most recent activity involves sending a request for bills to University of Cincinnati Physicians on January 6, 2025, and faxing a completed medical authorization form to an unspecified recipient on January 3, 2025. (See details), (See details)
A potential red flag is that as of January 6, 2025, the PIP adjuster had not received any completed forms from the Lindsey family, which could delay the processing of their claim. (See details)
The next steps should include following up with the PIP adjuster to ensure all necessary forms have been submitted, and continuing to gather medical records and bills from various providers, including Radiology Associates of Northern Kentucky, PLLC. (See details), (See details)
author: Justin Chumbley

*Download Instructions:*
This email or download link can only be accessed by the email address it
was sent to. *Please continue all correspondence with your Auto-Owners
contact.*
 1. Click this link:
 https://securefiletransfer.aoins.com/message/ABANMdUSAGflY5ZpoOhBFk
 2. Enter your e-mail and a Secure Token will be sent to you in a
 separate email.
 3. Click the files to download them. If there are many files, you can
 download them all at once by clicking the "Download All" button.
The files are available until: *Thursday, 13 February.*

“This site contains information that may be privileged and/or confidential
and exempt from disclosure. Such information is solely for the intended use
of the Recipient of this email. Recipient agrees not to disclose any such
information to others, except as allowed by law. Recipient will defend,
indemnify and hold harmless Auto-Owners Insurance Company from any claim or
suit for damages arising out of the disclosure or misuse of any such
information. Recipient further agrees to return, delete and/or destroy all
contents of this file after its intended use.”

All the best,
Jessa Galosmo
Whaley Law Firm

On March 14, 2025 at 11:10 AM, Jessa Galosmo emailed Filevine Project Email Address regarding "New Voice Message from LINDSEY JEREMY (502) 424-0049 on 03/14/2025":

Case: Elizabeth-Lindsey-MVA-12-01-2024
Client: Elizabeth Lindsey
__Fwd: New Voice Message from LINDSEY JEREMY (502) 424-0049 on 03/14/2025 10:59 AM__
Treatment update for Elizabeth and Chase
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: RingCentral
10:59 AM
To: Jessa Galosmo
[image: Logo] [image: Logo]
[image: Logo] Voice Message
------------------------------
Dear Jessa Galosmo,
You have a new voice message:
*From:* LINDSEY JEREMY (502) 424-0049
*Received:* Friday, March 14, 2025 at 10:59 AM
*Length:* 01:12
*To:* (502) 357-9975 Jessa Galosmo
*Voicemail Preview:*
"Hey, good morning. This is Jeremy Lindsey returning your call. I wanted to
provide an update for both Chase and Elizabeth. Chase has a final x ray for
his broken collarbone scheduled for april the second and hopefully we get
final clearance there. No more treatment is needed. But again, he is
scheduled for a final x ray for his collar Bone on april the second.
Elizabeth has continued treatment this following Monday, hoping that is
going to be her last treatment that is been ongoing for several weeks now.
And then she has a final consultation meeting with that orthopedist. I
believe it is in early April as well. I can get to the exact date, but
hopefully her last treatment and then she will have 1 final assessment as
well. So all things considered, assuming there is no changes, we are hoping
to have everyone cleared completely in early to mid April. So I will let
you know as soon as I know more, but that is the update for now. Thank you.
And as always, do not hesitate to reach out to you. Appreciate it."
Listen to this message over your phone or log in to your RingCentral account
 with your main number, extension number,
and password. You can also manage your voicemails in your RingCentral
account.
author: Jessa

Case: Elizabeth-Lindsey-MVA-12-01-2024
Client: Elizabeth Lindsey
__Re: Claim number: 300- 0793616-2024__
Hi Elizabeth,
Thanks for reaching out. Your hospital bills must be paid by your health
insurance. If they deny, that's when we'll use your PIP.
If you want, you may call Justin tomorrow to go over the details. His
direct line is (502) 450-9495.

Justin,

 Sent from Yahoo Mail for iPhone

On Wednesday, May 14, 2025, 2:41 PM, Appelman, Jennifer (She/Her/Hers) > wrote:
This message was sent securely.
Hello,
Please see attached claim forms, and itemized statements to submit to your auto insurance company. We reviewed the claims for both Owen and Chase this afternoon, and I have attached all outstanding claim forms that we went over.
I have also requested a hold be placed on the accounts so that you dont keep getting the automated calls for the outstanding balance.
Thank you,

episode_body:
On September 29, 2025 at 11:29 AM, Justin emailed Elizabethlindseymvaz4830969 regarding "Discover Additional Records for Request REQ-22409620":

Case: Elizabeth-Lindsey-MVA-12-01-2024
Client: Elizabeth Lindsey
__FW: Discover Additional Records for Request REQ-22409620__
From: noreply@salesforce.com On Behalf Of no-reply
To: jchumbley.wlf@gmail.com
Hello Justin,
You recently submitted a records request under Request REQ-22409620. This
request is in process and we will keep you updated on the status as it
progresses.
As an added benefit, we're excited to share that based on the patient
information from your request, we've also identified a list of additional
providers with relevant patient records that may be helpful to you.
If you would like to view the list of providers and order additional patient
records, please click the link below.
How does ChartSwap partner with you on finding additional records?
1.	ChartSwap searches for additional records: After submitting a record
request, ChartSwap will search for additional patient records, enabling more
insight into the patient's history.
2.	You will receive an email from ChartSwap if additional records are
found: ChartSwap will send you a communication sharing the valuable provider
locations that may have additional patient records (if applicable).
3.	View additional records: Log into ChartSwap and navigate to the
Record Finder page. After the ChartSwap provided patient authorization
 is submitted and approved, the provider details will be
visible for your review. The search results will include a listing of
locations where the patient received care and the record types available for
retrieval.
4.	Request the records valuable for your case: Select the records you
would like to retrieve - you can select a single location or as many as
needed.
5.	ChartSwap retrieves additional records: ChartSwap retrieves the
selected records and notifies you once they are available in the ChartSwap
portal.
Please note a completed ChartSwap provided patient authorization
 is required to view the full list of additional providers.
Thank you,
 ChartSwap
author: Filevine System
